comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

Firefox keeps hanging when I select "Get Add-ons" from the Addons tab. It might have to do with certain extension such as AutoPager and Add-on Compatibility Reporter.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.Install the following extensions in this collection:
https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/collections/john5084858/253992ee-f1a9-874a-d592-f6f7ec/
2.Go to Firefox menu -> Addons -> - Get-Addons
Actual Results:  
As you see the loading message, the browser freezes up.

Expected Results:  
It should have displayed what normally comes up when you click on "Get-Addons"

List of Plugins:

    Adobe Acrobat
    Cooliris embedded in a tab
    DivX Player Netscape Plugin
    DivX Web Player
    downloadUpdater
    downloadUpdater2
    Google Earth Plugin
    Google Update
    IE Tab Plug-in
    iTunes Application Detector
    Java Deployment Toolkit 6.0.240.7
    Java(TM) Platform SE 6 U24
    Microsoft® Windows Media Player Firefox Plugin
    Move Streaming Media Player
    QuickTime Plug-in 7.6.9
    RealJukebox NS Plugin
    RealNetworks Rhapsody Player Engine
    RealPlayer Version Plugin
    RealPlayer(tm) G2 LiveConnect-Enabled Plug-In (32-bit)
    RealPlayer(tm) HTML5VideoShim Plug-In (32-bit)
    Shockwave Flash
    Shockwave for Director
    Silverlight Plug-In
    Winamp Application Detector
    Windows Presentation Foundation

comments.creator: kwaczala84@hotmail.com
comments.author: kwaczala84@hotmail.com
hskupin@gmail.com
comments.text: What do you mean with freeze? Does Firefox completely hang? And it doesn't happen when the add-ons aren't installed? Do you get a slow script warning dialog?
comments.raw_text: What do you mean with freeze? Does Firefox completely hang? And it doesn't happen when the add-ons aren't installed? Do you get a slow script warning dialog?
comments.creator: hskupin@gmail.com

comments.author: kwaczala84@hotmail.com
comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> What do you mean with freeze? Does Firefox completely hang? And it doesn't
> happen when the add-ons aren't installed? Do you get a slow script warning
> dialog?

I get the "not responding" type of freeze. It does not happen when the add-ons are disabled. I have not seen a script warning.
comments.creator: kwaczala84@hotmail.com
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> What do you mean with freeze? Does Firefox completely hang? And it doesn't
> happen when the add-ons aren't installed? Do you get a slow script warning
> dialog?

I get the "not responding" type of freeze. It does not happen when the add-ons are disabled. I have not seen a script warning.

comments.author: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Can you disable the add-ons step by step until the freeze doesn't happen anymore?
comments.creator: hskupin@gmail.com
comments.text: Can you disable the add-ons step by step until the freeze doesn't happen anymore?
